title: Advanced Well Control Question Templates
description: Advanced scenario-based questions for daily well control coaching. These templates generate well-specific questions using real well data. Used alongside basic QUESTION_BANK questions for daily coaching.

dailyCoachingSystem.concept: Every morning, crew receives a brief explanation about their current drilling section plus 1-2 well control questions

questionMix.basic: Pulled from QUESTION_BANK - standard IWCF/IADC exam-style questions relevant to current operation
questionMix.advanced: Generated from these templates using actual well data - decision-focused scenarios
questionMix.delivery: 1-2 questions per day - can be basic, advanced, or mix depending on section/hazards

dailyCoachingSystem.sectionBriefing: Short explanation of key well control considerations for the current drilling section
dailyCoachingSystem.purpose: Continuous real-world training tied to the actual well being drilled - keeps skills sharp daily

targetAudience.role: All drilling crew - Floorhand to OIM
targetAudience.context: Active drilling operations on company wells
targetAudience.frequency: Daily coaching tied to current drilling section

usage.1: Company uploads well profile (DOP/Well Programme data)
usage.2: System identifies current drilling section and active hazards
usage.3: Daily briefing generated: section context + 1-2 relevant questions
usage.4: Basic questions selected from QUESTION_BANK based on section topics
usage.5: Advanced questions generated from these templates with real well values
usage.6: Crew answers on mobile/tablet - results tracked for competency

categories.OPERATIONAL_DECISIONS: Real-time decision making based on well conditions
categories.HAZARD_RESPONSE: Hazard-specific scenarios triggered by well profile hazards
categories.MPD_OPERATIONS: Managed Pressure Drilling scenarios for HPHT/tight window wells
categories.SUBSEA_ADVANCED: Advanced subsea scenarios beyond basic CLFL/riser margin
categories.EMERGENCY_SCENARIOS: High-stakes emergency response (EDS, loss of barriers, equipment failure)

templates.focus: Real-time flow check interpretation with well-specific tolerances
Multi-indicator interpretation in limited KT environment
Trip margin and swab pressure management in tight-window wells
Volumetric method during static conditions - gas migration management
Mobile salt drilling decisions for land rigs
Logistics and contingency planning for remote land operations
Surface back pressure management during connections
MPD vs conventional response decision-making
ECD management in tight PP/FG window
Decision-making when kick exceeds tolerance limits
Dual emergency management - well control + personnel safety
Pre-BOP diverter operations
Surface BOP well control for land/jackup rigs
Severe lost circulation management and escalation
Operations at equipment limits - prevention-focused drilling
Response to lost circulation and barrier compromise
Maintaining well control during equipment failure mid-kill
Operational riser margin decisions with real water depth/PP
Subsea kill operations with actual choke line data
EDS decision-making under time pressure
